newsitem.title: FINLAND: Aros trades large chunks in Pohjola.
newsitem.headline: Aros trades large chunks in Pohjola.

text.p: Brokerage Aros Securities on Monday traded 1,078,547 vote-strong A shares and 1,079,047 B shares in Pohjola at 101.50 markka (down 2.50) and 99.50 markka (up 0.50) respectively on the Helsinki Stock Exchange.
Aros and Pohjola declined to comment the deal.

A broker at another brokerage guessed that Kesko's Tuko would have sold its vote-strong but illiquid A shares -- it on September 4 held 1,078,147 A shares -- to one of the other large owners interest in votes rather than liquidity.
That owner would then have placed an about equivalent amount of liquid B shares with an international investor, he said.
Nobody at Tuko or Kesko was immediately avaible to comment.

Apart from Tuko, only mutual life insurer Suomi which already has links with Pohjola, banking group Merita and Merita's pension fund UBF Pension Fund had enough A shares to make such a transaction alone on September 4, a Pohjola official said.
Of Pohjola's large owners, only Suomi and Pohjola's Swedish partner Skandia per September 4 owned as many B shares as were now traded, the official said.
